channel.title: The Critic Show
channel.itunes:subtitle: We're talking about movies, TV, nostalgia and pop culture on The Critic Show. Along the way we provide commentary and get the opinions of celebrity guests and YOU! Get more out of an entertainment podcast by downloading The Critic Show podcast!
channel.itunes:author: Scott Murray
channel.itunes:summary: We're talking about movies, TV, nostalgia and pop culture on The Critic Show. Along the way we provide commentary and get the opinions of celebrity guests and YOU! Get more out of an entertainment podcast by downloading The Critic Show podcast!
channel.description: We're talking about movies, TV, nostalgia and pop culture on The Critic Show. Along the way we provide commentary and get the opinions of celebrity guests and YOU! Get more out of an entertainment podcast by downloading The Critic Show podcast!

item.title: Back in Time: The Movies of the 1980s
item.description: Special guest: Anthony Michael Hall! We celebrate some of the best films of the 80s! What are some of the best and which ones can we not bear to watch anymore? We have our first movie trivia game. Scott corrects a mistake from the last podcast in hopes that Mr. Miyagi forgives him.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray

We have our first movie trivia game. Scott corrects a mistake from the last podcast in hopes that Mr. Miyagi forgives him.

item.title: AVENGING the Summer Movie Season
item.description: We preview some of the movies of summer 2012. The Avengers seemed to start it off just right...but not everyone is applauding. Do they have good reasons for that? It's been awhile since we've been interested in so many movies in one summer. Is this the best summer movie season ever? The 80s might have something to say about that.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray

It's been awhile since we've been interested in so many movies in one summer. Is this the best summer movie season ever? The 80s might have something to say about that.

item.title: Mermaids, Beasts & Lots of Hair
item.description: Special guest: Glen Keane! This is the listener-picked topic of the season...animated movies. We highlight our favorite animated movies of all time and talk with legendary Disney animator, Glen Keane. We also look ahead to what other animated movies are coming out in 2012.

item.title: Critic Show Extra: Cowgirls 'N Angels
item.description: Cast and crew interviews include Bailee Madison, Jackson Rathbone, Alicia Witt, Amber Hayes and writer/director Timothy Armstrong. The movie Cowgirls 'N Angels premiered at the Dallas International Film Festival.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Cast and crew interviews include Bailee Madison, Jackson Rathbone, Alicia Witt, Amber Hayes and writer/director Timothy Armstrong. The movie Cowgirls 'N Angels premiered at the Dallas International Film Festival.

item.title: The Hunger Games (Books to Movies)
item.description: Story expert Robert McKee breaks down the challenges and drawbacks in turning a book into a film. We discuss how those challenges apply to The Hunger Games movie and we review the film.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Story expert Robert McKee breaks down the challenges and drawbacks in turning a book into a film. We discuss how those challenges apply to The Hunger Games movie and we review the film.
item.itunes:summary: Story expert Robert McKee breaks down the challenges and drawbacks in turning a book into a film. We discuss how those challenges apply to The Hunger Games movie and we review the film.

item.title: Critic Show Extra: Flip Orley
item.description: Comedian and hypnotist Flip Orley talks about what goes into his act and how he handles the unpredictable nature of the audience.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Comedian and hypnotist Flip Orley talks about what goes into his act and how he handles the unpredictable nature of the audience.
item.itunes:summary: Comedian and hypnotist Flip Orley talks about what goes into his act and how he handles the unpredictable nature of the audience.

item.title: Making Us Laugh
item.description: Comedians Pablo Francisco and John Caparulo are the headline acts for this podcast. A disgruntled listener named Roy D. Mercer threatens Scott with an ass whoopin'. We preview the upcoming Critic Show Extra featuring comedian/hypnotist Flip Orely. Lots of laughs in this episode!

item.title: Men, Women & Romantic Comedy
item.description: Guests include actors Charles Grodin (Woman in Red), James Hampton, Mary Deese and writer Liz Shannon Miller. We discuss the romantic comedy and ask were they better 20 or more years ago? Also, can they ever appeal to men? What do they say about men, women and relationships?

item.title: Bring That Show Back!
item.description: Special Guest: Ron Glass of Firefly! We talk about shows that we want cancelled and those that we want back on the air. Daniel Manu of Television Without Pity joins the show to talk about the current cancellation process of a television series. Listeners call in and share their thoughts!

Daniel Manu of Television Without Pity joins the show to talk about the current cancellation process of a television series. Listeners call in and share their thoughts!

item.title: And Now for Something Completely British
item.description: Red Dwarf's Danny John-Jules and Monty Python's Carol Cleveland are guests! We take a look at British comedy.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Red Dwarf's Danny John-Jules and Monty Python's Carol Cleveland are guests! We take a look at British comedy.

item.description: Scott talks to Juliana Donald about playing Jenny in The Muppets Take Manhattan.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott talks to Juliana Donald about playing Jenny in The Muppets Take Manhattan.

item.title: Red Tails, Hollywood & History
item.description: Special guests: Master Sergeant Joseph Montgomery and Colonel Charles McGee (Tuskegee Airmen)! We take a look at the balance between facts and fiction in historical movies. Red Tails is examined and reviewed.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: Special guests: Master Sergeant Joseph Montgomery and Colonel Charles McGee (Tuskegee Airmen)! We take a look at the balance between facts and fiction in historical movies. Red Tails is examined and reviewed.

item.title: A Sci-Fi Spotlight on Star Wars
item.description: Special Guests: Jake Lloyd, Billy Dee Williams, Daniel Logan and Bonnie Piesse. It's the Season 2 premiere and our biggest show yet! With Episode 1: The Phantom Menace hitting theaters next month in 3-D, we take a closer look at the newer trilogy while remembering the older one.

item.title: Critic Show Extra: Richard Jefferies
item.description: Author Richard Jefferies talks about the book he's written about his brother Matt...the designer of the USS Enterprise.

item.title: Critic Show Extra: Ashley Eckstein
item.description: Actress Ashley Eckstein talks about being the voice of Ahsoka Tano in Star Wars: The Clone Wars and her clothing line for fangirls.

item.title: The Holiday Movie Wrap Up
item.description: It's the holiday season and the season finale all in one show! Some of your favorite holiday movies and songs are showcased in this episode. Also, we'll take a look at some of the best moments from the first eleven episodes of the podcast. Some of the show's past guests share some holiday wishes and Scott shares his Hollywood Christmas wish list. And we get a visit from Santa! (sort of).

item.title: The Great Muppet Episode
item.description: Charles Grodin is our special guest as Muppet fever has hit The Critic Show podcast. We'll talk about some of the best in Muppet TV and film! Also Ryan Dosier of The Muppet Mindset and Steve Swanson of the Muppetcast stop by to review the new Muppet movie. You've never heard an episode of the show like this one!

item.title: A Sci-Fi Spotlight on Star Trek
item.description: Special Guest: Walter Koenig! Just how much Star Trek stuff can be put into one podcast? Only one way to find out. In this episode, you'll hear some of the latest Star Trek News, Walter Koenig talk about playing the role of Chekov on the original series, Trekkie opinions and learn about the man behind the design of the USS Enterprise!

item.title: Halloween & Horrors
item.description: What makes a great horror movie? Scott talks to story expert Robert McKee about producing a successful horror story. Your best and worst horror movies are shared. Also, what happens to us after we've watched a movie that scared us? It's all in this Halloween edition of the podcast!

item.title: Legend of the Cult Classic
item.description: Bridget Regan (Legend of the Seeker) and Richard Riehle (Office Space) are guests as we examine cult classic movies and TV shows. Also, a tribute to Jim Henson.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray

item.title: The Fall TV Examination
item.description: Our special guest is Mayim Bialik (Amy Farrah Fowler) of The Big Bang Theory. Daniel Manu of Television Without Pity talks about the upcoming fall TV season. You share your most obscure TV favorites that your friends aren't familiar with.
item.itunes:author: Scott Murray
